review_title: I wouldn't have stayed over 9 years if this was not a very special place to work...
pros: The charity lives and breathes its values of Kindness, Courage and Excellence.
cons: The delicious food in the highly subsidized cafe has not done anything for my waitlist!!

pros: This is the best job I have ever had. The team is really supportive and I'm encouraged to pursue my passions. I have made some requests from the senior leadership team which were listened and responded to which was great. Supporting amazing children is a privilege and being based on a nature reserve is also a massive plus!
cons:
Nothing major. Every time I've had any issue (e.g. around workload), I've been supported by my Manager to improve the situation.

Whilst we're very inclusive with who we support, I think we could do more to support diversity in the staff team. I believe that there's a lot being planned around this which is great.

job_title: Child and Family Social Worker in Barnet, England
pros: The cause, the team, the facility.
cons: Lack of any career progression. Ridiculously poor wage structure.

job_title: Family Support Worker in London, England
pros: The families you get to know, independent working
cons:
No progression,
no emotional support 
lack of communication amongst teams

pros: People, office culture, progression, flexible working
cons: Lower wages than other london charities
